memberdef.name: RAPIDJSON_PARSE_ERROR_NORETURN
memberdef.initializer: RAPIDJSON_MULTILINEMACRO_BEGIN \ RAPIDJSON_ASSERT(!HasParseError()); /* Error can only be assigned once */ \ SetParseError(parseErrorCode, offset); \ RAPIDJSON_MULTILINEMACRO_END

briefdescription.para: Macro to indicate a parse error.

detaileddescription.para:
parseErrorCode
rapidjson::ParseErrorCode of the error
offset
position of the error in JSON input (size_t)
This macros can be used as a customization point for the internal error handling mechanism of RapidJSON.
A common usage model is to throw an exception instead of requiring the caller to explicitly check the rapidjson::GenericReader::Parse's return value:

briefdescription.para: (Internal) macro to indicate and handle a parse error.

detaileddescription.para:
parseErrorCode
rapidjson::ParseErrorCode of the error
offset
position of the error in JSON input (size_t)
Invokes RAPIDJSON_PARSE_ERROR_NORETURN and stops the parsing.

briefdescription.para: Iterative(constant complexity in terms of function call stack size) parsing.
After parsing a complete JSON root from stream, stop further processing the rest of stream. When this flag is used, parser will not generate kParseErrorDocumentRootNotSingular error.
Parse number in full precision (but slower).
Allow trailing commas at the end of objects and arrays.
Allow parsing NaN, Inf, Infinity, -Inf and -Infinity as doubles.
Default parse flags. Can be customized by defining RAPIDJSON_PARSE_DEFAULT_FLAGS.
Reader with UTF8 encoding and default allocator.
Skip the JSON white spaces in a stream.

parameterdescription.para: A input stream for skipping white spaces.
